constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 38 (Wednesday, March 2, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. LONG:
H.R. 6902.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article 1, Section 8, Clause 7: The Congress shall have the
Power to establish Post Offices and post Roads
[Page H1275]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 660 East Harrison Street, in Republic, Missouri, as the "Special Agent Sgt. Joseph M. Peters Post Office".
